concept.title: Create a GitHub Identity App for Use with Livefyre Identity
concept.shortdesc: You can use Livefyre Identity with GitHub Identity to allow users to use their GitHub logins to interact Apps on your site.

conbody.p: To allow users to log in with their GitHub Identity credentials, Livefyre requires the following GitHub Identity Information:
To create an GitHub Identity App for use with Livefyre Identity:

ol.li: Create or sign in to a GitHub account at .
Register a new or select an existing app for use with Livefyre Identity.

Enter all information on the form. Enter the Authorization callback URL, using your network name instead of {network-name}: {network-name}: https://identy.livefyre.com/{network-name}.fyre.co/api/v.1.0/public/profile/social/complete/github_fyre.
In Livefyre Integration Settings Livefyre Identity GitHub, switch the Enable GitHub Login toggle to On.
Enter the GitHub Client ID and GitHub Client Secret.

conbody.p: When complete, GitHub Identity’s app details page will list the App’s Client ID (Consumer Key) and Client Secret (Consumer Secret) for use in Studio’s Integration Settings page.
